unnormalised: Dr. Rajesh Kumar, a renowned cardiologist at AIIMS, Delhi, just landed a big promotion! He's officially been named the Head of Cardiology, guys! Can you believe it? Only 45 yrs old too! What an inspiration, right?
normalised: Doctor Rajesh Kumar, a renowned cardiologist at A-I-I-M-S, Delhi, just landed a big promotion! He's officially been named the Head of Cardiology, guys! Can you believe it? Only forty five years old too! What an inspiration, right?

unnormalised: Word on the street is that he was competing with Dr. Sharma and Dr. Kapoor for the role, but his innovative research on tackling heart disease in younger adults, published in the Indian Journal of Medical Research (IJMR), gave him the edge. Seriously impressive stuff!
normalised: Word on the street is that he was competing with Doctor Sharma and Doctor Kapoor for the role, but his innovative research on tackling heart disease in younger adults, published in the Indian Journal of Medical Research (I-J-M-R), gave him the edge. Seriously impressive stuff!

unnormalised: Apparently, the selection committee, which included the hospital director and some senior profs from the medical college, were super impressed with his presentation. I heard it was all about using AI in early diagnosis - cutting-edge stuff!
normalised: Apparently, the selection committee, which included the hospital director and some senior professors from the medical college, were super impressed with his presentation. I heard it was all about using A-I in early diagnosis - cutting-edge stuff!

unnormalised: I remember when he first joined AIIMS as a junior res. He was always burning the midnight oil, studying and researching. All that hard work paid off, huh? Talk about dedication!
normalised: I remember when he first joined A-I-I-M-S as a junior resident. He was always burning the midnight oil, studying and researching. All that hard work paid off, huh? Talk about dedication!

unnormalised: He's not just a brilliant doctor, tho. I’ve heard from patients themselves that he’s super approachable and really takes the time to explain things. Like, he doesn't just rattle off medical jargon, you know? He speaks in plain Hindi/English, which everyone appreciates. Very down to earth, for such a big shot!
normalised: He's not just a brilliant doctor, though. I’ve heard from patients themselves that he’s super approachable and really takes the time to explain things. Like, he doesn't just rattle off medical jargon, you know? He speaks in plain Hindi or English, which everyone appreciates. Very down to earth, for such a big shot!

unnormalised: Plus, he’s always encouraging junior doctors and nurses. A colleague of mine, who’s a nurse at AIIMS, told me Dr. Kumar always makes her feel like her opinions matter. That’s the kind of leader you want, isn’t it?
normalised: Plus, he’s always encouraging junior doctors and nurses. A colleague of mine, who’s a nurse at A-I-I-M-S, told me Doctor Kumar always makes her feel like her opinions matter. That’s the kind of leader you want, isn’t it?

unnormalised: Anyway, congrats to Dr. Kumar! This is fantastic news not just for him, but for AIIMS and for cardiology in India. Here's hoping he continues his amazing work and inspires even more young doctors. I'm sure he will! He's always been a real 'do-gooder', as my naniji would say. All the best! Let’s see what the future brings under his leadership! Exciting times ahead, folks!
normalised: Anyway, congrats to Doctor Kumar! This is fantastic news not just for him, but for A-I-I-M-S and for cardiology in India. Here's hoping he continues his amazing work and inspires even more young doctors. I'm sure he will! He's always been a real 'do-gooder', as my naniji would say. All the best! Let’s see what the future brings under his leadership! Exciting times ahead, folks!

unnormalised: He replaced Dr. Menon who retired last month, btw.
normalised: He replaced Doctor Menon who retired last month, by the way.
